Operations_List.title: Lists all of the available REST API operations of the Microsoft.StorSimple provider
Operations_List.description: Lists all of the available REST API operations of the Microsoft.StorSimple provider

Managers_List.title: Retrieves all the managers in a subscription.
Managers_List.description: Retrieves all the managers in a subscription.

Managers_ListByResourceGroup.title: Retrieves all the managers in a resource group.
Managers_ListByResourceGroup.description: Retrieves all the managers in a resource group.

Managers_Get.title: Returns the properties of the specified manager name.
Managers_Get.description: Returns the properties of the specified manager name.

AccessControlRecords_ListByManager.title: Retrieves all the access control records in a manager.
AccessControlRecords_ListByManager.description: Retrieves all the access control records in a manager.

AccessControlRecords_Get.title: Returns the properties of the specified access control record name.
AccessControlRecords_Get.description: Returns the properties of the specified access control record name.

AccessControlRecords_CreateOrUpdate.title: Creates or Updates an access control record.
AccessControlRecords_CreateOrUpdate.description: Creates or Updates an access control record.

Alerts_ListByManager.title: Retrieves all the alerts in a manager.
Alerts_ListByManager.description: Retrieves all the alerts in a manager.

BandwidthSettings_ListByManager.title: Retrieves all the bandwidth setting in a manager.
BandwidthSettings_ListByManager.description: Retrieves all the bandwidth setting in a manager.

BandwidthSettings_Get.title: Returns the properties of the specified bandwidth setting name.
BandwidthSettings_Get.description: Returns the properties of the specified bandwidth setting name.

BandwidthSettings_CreateOrUpdate.title: Creates or updates the bandwidth setting
BandwidthSettings_CreateOrUpdate.description: Creates or updates the bandwidth setting

CloudAppliances_ListSupportedConfigurati.title: Lists supported cloud appliance models and supported configurations.
CloudAppliances_ListSupportedConfigurati.description: Lists supported cloud appliance models and supported configurations.

Devices_Configure.title: Complete minimal setup before using the device.
Devices_Configure.description: Complete minimal setup before using the device.

Devices_ListByManager.title: Returns the list of devices for the specified manager.
Devices_ListByManager.description: Returns the list of devices for the specified manager.

Devices_Get.title: Returns the properties of the specified device.
Devices_Get.description: Returns the properties of the specified device.

DeviceSettings_GetAlertSettings.title: Gets the alert settings of the specified device.
DeviceSettings_GetAlertSettings.description: Gets the alert settings of the specified device.

DeviceSettings_CreateOrUpdateAlertSettin.title: Creates or updates the alert settings of the specified device.
DeviceSettings_CreateOrUpdateAlertSettin.description: Creates or updates the alert settings of the specified device.

Devices_AuthorizeForServiceEncryptionKey.title: Authorizes the specified device for service data encryption key rollover.
Devices_AuthorizeForServiceEncryptionKey.description: Authorizes the specified device for service data encryption key rollover.

BackupPolicies_ListByDevice.title: Gets all the backup policies in a device.
BackupPolicies_ListByDevice.description: Gets all the backup policies in a device.

BackupPolicies_Get.title: Gets the properties of the specified backup policy name.
BackupPolicies_Get.description: Gets the properties of the specified backup policy name.

BackupPolicies_CreateOrUpdate.title: Creates or updates the backup policy.
BackupPolicies_CreateOrUpdate.description: Creates or updates the backup policy.

BackupSchedules_ListByBackupPolicy.title: Gets all the backup schedules in a backup policy.
BackupSchedules_ListByBackupPolicy.description: Gets all the backup schedules in a backup policy.

BackupSchedules_Get.title: Gets the properties of the specified backup schedule name.
BackupSchedules_Get.description: Gets the properties of the specified backup schedule name.

BackupSchedules_CreateOrUpdate.title: Creates or updates the backup schedule.
BackupSchedules_CreateOrUpdate.description: Creates or updates the backup schedule.

Backups_ListByDevice.title: Retrieves all the backups in a device.
Backups_ListByDevice.description: Retrieves all the backups in a device.

Backups_Clone.title: Clones the backup element as a new volume.
Backups_Clone.description: Clones the backup element as a new volume.

Backups_Restore.title: Restores the backup on the device.
Backups_Restore.description: Restores the backup on the device.

HardwareComponentGroups_ListByDevice.title: Lists the hardware component groups at device-level.
HardwareComponentGroups_ListByDevice.description: Lists the hardware component groups at device-level.

HardwareComponentGroups_ChangeController.title: Changes the power state of the controller.
HardwareComponentGroups_ChangeController.description: Changes the power state of the controller.

Devices_InstallUpdates.title: Downloads and installs the updates on the device.
Devices_InstallUpdates.description: Downloads and installs the updates on the device.

Jobs_ListByDevice.title: Gets all the jobs for specified device. With optional OData query parameters, a filtered set of jobs is returned.
Jobs_ListByDevice.description: Gets all the jobs for specified device. With optional OData query parameters, a filtered set of jobs is returned.

Jobs_Get.title: Gets the details of the specified job name.
Jobs_Get.description: Gets the details of the specified job name.

Jobs_Cancel.title: Cancels a job on the device.
Jobs_Cancel.description: Cancels a job on the device.

Devices_ListFailoverSets.title: Returns all failover sets for a given device and their eligibility for participating in a failover. A failover set refers to a set of volume containers that need to be failed-over as a single unit to maintain data integrity.
Devices_ListFailoverSets.description: Returns all failover sets for a given device and their eligibility for participating in a failover. A failover set refers to a set of volume containers that need to be failed-over as a single unit to maintain data integrity.

Devices_ListMetrics.title: Gets the metrics for the specified device.
Devices_ListMetrics.description: Gets the metrics for the specified device.

Devices_ListMetricDefinition.title: Gets the metric definitions for the specified device.
Devices_ListMetricDefinition.description: Gets the metric definitions for the specified device.

DeviceSettings_GetNetworkSettings.title: Gets the network settings of the specified device.
DeviceSettings_GetNetworkSettings.description: Gets the network settings of the specified device.

DeviceSettings_UpdateNetworkSettings.title: Updates the network settings on the specified device.
DeviceSettings_UpdateNetworkSettings.description: Updates the network settings on the specified device.

Managers_GetDevicePublicEncryptionKey.title: Returns the public encryption key of the device.

Devices_ScanForUpdates.title: Scans for updates on the device.
Devices_ScanForUpdates.description: Scans for updates on the device.

DeviceSettings_GetTimeSettings.description: Gets the time settings of the specified device.

Devices_GetUpdateSummary.title: Returns the update summary of the specified device name.

VolumeContainers_Get.description: Gets the properties of the specified volume container name.

Devices_Failover.title: Failovers a set of volume containers from a specified source device to a target device.
Devices_Failover.description: Failovers a set of volume containers from a specified source device to a target device.

Devices_ListFailoverTargets.title: Given a list of volume containers to be failed over from a source device, this method returns the eligibility result, as a failover target, for all devices under that resource.
Devices_ListFailoverTargets.description: Given a list of volume containers to be failed over from a source device, this method returns the eligibility result, as a failover target, for all devices under that resource.
